question:
Latin Name: Water carrier, cup carrier
Best Viewed In: October
Description: Ganymede in mythology, large, faint

Latin Name: Eagle
Best Viewed In: Late Summer, September
Description: Eagle bore Ganymede to Mt. Olympus, contains Altair

Latin Name: Ram
Best Viewed In: December
Description: One of the zodiac, ram's fleece became the Golden Fleece

Latin Name: Greater Dog
Best Viewed In: February
Description: Laelaps in mythology, Orion's hunting dog, contains Sirius (brightest star) and Adhara

Latin Name: None - Greek Queen
Best Viewed In: November
Description: Vain queen in mythology, mother of Andromeda, "W" shape

Latin Name: Swan
Best Viewed In: September
Description: "Northern Cross", asterism, contains the bright Deneb in the tail

Latin Name: Twins
Best Viewed In: February
Description: Twins Castor and Pollux (both bright stars), "U" shape, next to Orion

Latin Name: Lion
Best Viewed In: April
Description: Killed by Hercules (12 Labors), backwards question mark shape, contains Regulus

Latin Name: Lyre
Best Viewed In: August
Description: Orpheus's harp from Apollo, lopsided square with a tail, contains Vega

Latin Name: <Greek Hunter>
Best Viewed In: January
Description: Most famous, son of Poseidon, belt, contains Rigel and Betelgeuse

Latin Name: Fish
Best Viewed In: November
Description: Aphrodite and son Eros, forms large "V" and small "O"

Latin Name: Scorpion
Best Viewed In: July
Description: Defeated Orion, contains the bright Antares

Latin Name: Bull
Best Viewed In: January
Description: Zeus in disguise for infidelity, forms "V", contains Aldebaran

Latin Name: Larger Bear
Best Viewed In: April
Description: "Big Dipper", Hera/Zeus turned her and her son into bears, leads to North Star

Latin Name: Smaller Bear
Best Viewed In: June
Description: "Little Dipper", contains Polaris (North Star) as the bear's tail
